Description: Offset rim and body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery kylix; glaze and added colour very worn except for some red (which otherwise leaves an orange 'ghost') and the black dots, clearly from a different batch of glaze matter; interior: red band at rim; outlined alternating red and black tongues below; traces of glaze on inside of shoulder; exterior: on rim, cable pattern (only two rows of incised black dots preserved) between worn, probably black, bands; on bowl, black-figure decoration, perhaps head of lion to right.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.1201, 1924, 1201.1205,1924,1201.1207,1924,1201.1208 and 1924,1201.1224. For a similar cable pattern, see Newhall Stillwell, A. and Benson, J. L., Corinth: Results of Excavations Conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens XV.3: The Potters Quarter - The Pottery. Princeton 1984, pl. 41 no. 886a and 903, both are late Corinthian.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.099) (Phase 1)
